hero.name: Gabriel F. de Carvalho
hero.title: Gabriel F. de Carvalho
hero.subtitle: I develop APIs and internal integrations for education, government, and university systems. I work with relational databases, secure authentication, and technical documentation to ensure institutional systems are stable, auditable, and easy to maintain.
hero.bullet1: I develop APIs and internal integrations for education, government, and university systems.
hero.bullet2: I deliver APIs documented in OpenAPI, automated tests, and integrations that eliminate manual processes and spreadsheets.
hero.bullet3: I guarantee systems with complete traceability for institutional compliance and long-term maintenance.

section1.title: Gabriel Fernandes de Carvalho
section1.subtitle: Backend Developer with experience in Laravel, NodeJS, Python, .NET, PHP and Java
section1.intro: Scroll to discover my skills and projects
section1.bio: Back-end Developer with solid experience in Laravel, NodeJS, .NET, Python, PHP and Java. Works at Fábrica de Tecnologias Turing (FTT) of UniEVANGÉLICA, contributing to robust systems for educational and research institutions. Also participated in solutions for the Brazilian Air Force and maintains active academic projects.

summary.title: Professional summary
summary.paragraph1: I'm a back-end developer focused on institutional systems. I work mainly with Laravel (PHP), Node.js/TypeScript, Python, .NET/C#, and Java, using relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite.
summary.paragraph2: I develop REST APIs documented in OpenAPI and validated with automated tests. I work with internal integrations like SSO, messaging, and academic systems, applying LGPD, encryption, and auditable controls. I work at Fábrica de Tecnologias Turing at UniEVANGÉLICA and on projects for the Brazilian Air Force, always prioritizing stability, traceability, and long-term maintenance.
summary.paragraph3: I collaborate with designers, product team, and legal to approve releases with observability metrics and defined SLAs, ensuring institutional systems meet compliance and audit requirements.

jac.title: JAC – Academic and Community Journey
jac.impact: Centralizes events and student presence with intelligent check-in, eliminating manual registration processes and providing executive visibility on participation in academic events. Strategic dashboards help managers make data-driven decisions.
jac.roleShort: I developed the complete system architecture, modeling event and presence domains. I implemented LGPD protections and made continuous handoff to the maintenance team.
jac.result: Results tracked through executive dashboards and feedback from the management team.

fanstone.title: James Fanstone System
fanstone.impact: Organizes institutional research processes with auditable flows, ensuring complete traceability of approvals and reports. Integration with Lyceum eliminates data duplication and reduces manual errors.
fanstone.roleShort: I modeled the system domain, developed REST APIs in Laravel, and implemented auditable academic integrations. I worked with the research team to validate requirements and ensure flows met institutional needs.
fanstone.result: Results tracked through dashboards and feedback from the research team.

esports.title: Portal 3rd E-Sports UniEVANGÉLICA
esports.impact: Publishes tournament schedule and registrations with clear access on mobile devices, facilitating participation by students and external community. The portal replaced manual registration and communication processes.
esports.roleShort: I developed the responsive front-end with modular SCSS, implemented client-side validation, and structured the code for accessibility. I worked with designers to ensure a consistent visual experience.
esports.result: Portal published and used during tournament events, with positive feedback on mobile accessibility and ease of use.

ftt.bullet1: I developed REST APIs with Node.js and TypeScript, versioning OpenAPI contracts and reducing rework for the development team.
ftt.bullet2: I implemented integrations via messaging and internal SSO, optimizing PostgreSQL queries and maintaining low latency in critical systems.
ftt.bullet3: I participated in technical reviews and implemented observability with structured logs, helping anticipate incidents in institutional releases.

proppe.bullet1: I modeled research flows with Laravel and PostgreSQL, automating multi-step approvals and auditable trails.
proppe.bullet2: I integrated Lyceum and ERPs with secure APIs and queues, eliminating recurring manual registrations and reducing operational errors.
proppe.bullet3: I built Vue.js dashboards for directors and researchers, reducing report delays and improving process visibility.

fab.bullet1: I implemented an availability API in .NET with JWT authentication, controlling profiles and ensuring operational traceability.
fab.bullet2: I defined test pipelines and automatic coverage, documenting routes with Swagger for internal audits.
fab.bullet3: I instrumented logs in Elasticsearch and configured objective alerts, reducing response time to availability incidents.

section5.title: Institutional and Private Projects
section5.subtitle: Systems developed for educational and research institutions

projects.title: JAC – Academic and Community Journey
projects.description: Institutional web platform for managing academic and community events, with geofencing and QR Code check-in, gamification system, management dashboards and integrated SSO.
projects.role: Co-author of architecture, main backend, support in prototyping (Figma)

projects.title: James Fanstone System
projects.description: Institutional platform for complete management of scientific research and innovation at Centro Universitário de Anápolis (UniEVANGÉLICA), including projects, groups, calls, reports, ethics forms and integration with Lyceum system. Developed by Fábrica de Tecnologias Turing, in collaboration with the Research and Innovation Coordination of PROPPE.
projects.role: Backend development and support for institutional flow modeling

projects.title: Portal 3rd E-Sports UniEVANGÉLICA
projects.description: Institutional website for competitive event with integration between design (Figma) and front-end development, responsive schedule, registration form and rules modal.
projects.role: Final version development and mobile adaptation

projects.title: Resource Availability Control
projects.description: Backend API for scheduling and controlling availability of institutional resources, with permission control and JWT authentication.

projects.title: Automated Reports System
projects.description: Automated generation of management reports with Python + Selenium, PDF templates and automatic email sending.
